overallGoal: Master the fundamentals of thermodynamics and heat transfer

keyConcepts.explanation: The law of conservation of energy - energy can neither be created nor destroyed, only transformed from one form to another.
The entropy of an isolated system not in equilibrium will tend to increase over time, approaching a maximum value at equilibrium.
The three primary mechanisms of heat transfer: conduction, convection, and radiation.

items.details: Learn the fundamental concepts, terminology, and definitions used in thermodynamics.
Understand the law of conservation of energy and its applications.
Explore the concept of entropy and irreversibility in thermodynamic processes.
Practice calculating entropy changes in various processes.

keyFormulas.usage_context: Relates the change in internal energy (ΔU) to heat added (Q) and work done (W)
Calculates the change in entropy (ΔS) for a reversible process
Fourier's law relating heat flux (q) to temperature gradient (∇T) via thermal conductivity (k)

generalTips: Create a concept map linking the various thermodynamic principles
Solve at least 3 practice problems for each topic
Explain concepts in your own words to check understanding
